author: Alex Schley
title: UMaine unveils robotic cow milking facility | News | foxbangor.com
text:
ORONO ‚Äî The University of Maine celebrated a milestone Wednesday with the opening of its new robotic cow milking facility.
Located at Witter Farm on the university‚Äôs Orono campus, the facility is only the third of its kind in Maine.
According to a study conducted by the Maine Department of Agriculture, Conservation and Forestry, the rising cost of labor and supplies‚Äîcombined with flatlining revenue‚Äîhas forced many dairy farms across the state to close.
Witter Farm Superintendent Patricia Henderson said robotic milking machines could help address this issue.
‚ÄúDo we pay our grain bill or do we pay our employees this month? And this is really going to help those farms understand the investment in robotics and how to help bridge that gap in their challenges,‚Äù said Henderson.
Henderson said the machine works by allowing cows to choose when they‚Äôre milked.
‚ÄúShe walks into the stanchion. It will ID her by her ear tag. And it will know exactly who it is, how much milk she‚Äôs making, what she did, you know, six hours before, and exactly where the teat placement is on her udder,‚Äù said Henderson.
Mary Castonguay, an Organic Valley dairy farmer and board member of the Maine Dairy Industry Association, agrees the new technology will help address the labor shortage.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to find good, reliable help. And a lot of farms are turning to robots for milking,‚Äù said Castonguay.
The new facility also benefits students involved in the program, who were previously tasked with milking the university‚Äôs 35 cows twice a day. Now, they can focus on skills that will be more beneficial for their careers.
‚ÄúRather than our students doing actual milking and all the labor-intensive parts of the dairy farm, now they get to learn the robotics side of it, which is going to help them for future careers and stuff because, obviously, the industry is going robotic. So we‚Äôre going to need to train people who know and understand robotics if this is the industry they want to go into,‚Äù said Henderson.
Henderson said they anticipate giving the cows 24-hour access to the machine will increase milk productivity by about 15 percent.

author: RLT
title: El tiempo en Zamora en Semana Santa: Aemet pronostica unas vacaciones revueltas
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos RLT Valencia Viernes, 22 de marzo 2024, 19:37 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Compartir La previsi√≥n del tiempo en Semana Santa en Zamora es una de las mayores preocupaciones para todos los que planifican sus vacaciones y viajes en estas fechas o simplemente buscan descansar en esta localidad. ¬øHabr√° lluvia o saldr√° el sol? ¬øCambiar√° el tiempo estos d√≠as? Aemet ha pronosticado una Semana Santa pasada por agua en casi toda Espa√±a por la llegada de una DANA que barrer√° la pen√≠nsula de oeste a este, aunque dejar√° zonas con sol en especial en el litoral mediterr√°neo. Si vas a pasar la Semana Santa o la Pascua en Zamora o en localidades cercanas, puedes consultar la previsi√≥n del tiempo oficial de Aemet para la Semana Santa 2024 en tiempo real y el pron√≥stico para los d√≠as siguientes. La predicci√≥n de los mapas se actualiza autom√°ticamente con el paso de los d√≠as, por lo que podr√°s consultar la previsi√≥n oficial del tiempo de Aemet durante toda la Semana Santa y los d√≠as posteriores. < body > < p >Como analista del tiempo, presento un detallado pron√≥stico para la ciudad de Zamora en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. El d√≠a 22 de marzo, durante el periodo de 6 a 12 horas, se espera un cielo poco nuboso con una temperatura m√≠nima de 9¬∫ y una m√°xima de 26¬∫. La sensaci√≥n t√©rmica oscilar√° entre los mismos valores y la humedad ser√° del 40% al 85%. < p >Para el mismo d√≠a, pero en el periodo de 12 a 18 horas, se esperan intervalos nubosos con una temperatura de 21¬∫. La probabilidad de lluvia es del 10%. En cuanto a la sensaci√≥n t√©rmica y la humedad, ser√°n similares a las del periodo anterior. < h2 >Pron√≥stico para los d√≠as siguientes < p >El 23 de marzo, durante la ma√±ana (6-12h), se esperan nubes altas con una temperatura de 17¬∫. No hay probabilidad de lluvia y la humedad ser√° del 50% al 85%. Por la tarde (12-18h), el cielo estar√° poco nuboso con una temperatura de 19¬∫. Al finalizar el d√≠a (18-24h), se espera un cielo despejado con una temperatura de 9¬∫. < p >El d√≠a siguiente, el 24 de marzo, se espera un cielo poco nuboso durante todo el d√≠a con temperaturas entre los 4¬∫ y los 21¬∫. No hay probabilidad de lluvia y la humedad oscilar√° entre el 30% y el 80%. < h2 >Previsi√≥n para los √∫ltimos d√≠as del pron√≥stico < p >El 25 de marzo se esperan intervalos nubosos por la ma√±ana y nubosidad con lluvia escasa por la tarde. Las temperaturas oscilar√°n entre los 4¬∫ y los 17¬∫. La probabilidad de lluvia aumenta al 50% por la tarde. < p >Para finalizar, los d√≠as 26, 27 y 28 de marzo se esperan cielos muy nubosos con lluvia. Las temperaturas oscilar√°n entre los 2¬∫ y los 19¬∫, y la probabilidad de lluvia ser√° del 100%. La humedad estar√° entre el 45% y el 100%. author: Stock Story
title: Nature's Sunshine (NASDAQ:NATR) Surprises With Strong Q3, Full-Year Sales Guidance Is Optimistic By Stock Story
text:
Stock Story -
Wellness products company Nature‚Äôs Sunshine Products (NASDAQ:NATR) reported Q3 CY2024 results beating Wall Street‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 3.1% year on year to $114.6 million. The company‚Äôs full-year revenue guidance of $445.5 million at the midpoint came in 1.4% above analysts‚Äô estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.23 per share was also 64.3% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.
Is now the time to buy Nature's Sunshine? Find out by reading the original article on StockStory, it‚Äôs free .
Nature's Sunshine (NATR) Q3 CY2024 Highlights:
Revenue: $114.6 million vs analyst estimates of $108.9 million (5.2% beat) Adjusted EPS: $0.23 vs analyst estimates of $0.14 ($0.09 beat) EBITDA: $10.73 million vs analyst estimates of $9.36 million (14.7% beat) The company lifted its revenue guidance for the full year to $445.5 million at the midpoint from $440.5 million, a 1.1% increase EBITDA guidance for the full year is $41 million at the midpoint, above analyst estimates of $39.56 million Gross Margin (GAAP): 71.3%, down from 73.1% in the same quarter last year Operating Margin: 4.6%, in line with the same quarter last year EBITDA Margin: 9.4%, in line with the same quarter last year Free Cash Flow Margin: 6.9%, down from 8.9% in the same quarter last year Market Capitalization: $263.2 million ‚ÄúThe third quarter delivered the highest sales volume this year, with $114.6 million in sales, up 4% versus prior year on a local currency basis. The strong performance was driven by robust customer growth in Japan and Taiwan, continued progress in Korea, and strong execution and customer activation in Central Europe.‚Äù said Terrence Moorehead, CEO of Nature‚Äôs Sunshine.Company OverviewStarted on a kitchen table in Utah, Nature‚Äôs Sunshine Products (NASDAQ:NATR) manufactures and sells nutritional and personal care products.
Personal Care While personal care products products may seem more discretionary than food, consumers tend to maintain or even boost their spending on the category during tough times. This phenomenon is known as "the lipstick effect" by economists, which states that consumers still want some semblance of affordable luxuries like beauty and wellness when the economy is sputtering.Consumer tastes are constantly changing, and personal care companies are currently responding to the public‚Äôs increased desire for ethically produced goods by featuring natural ingredients in their products.
Sales Growth A company‚Äôs long-term performance is an indicator of its overall business quality. While any business can experience short-term success, top-performing ones enjoy sustained growth for multiple years.Nature's Sunshine is a small consumer staples company, which sometimes brings disadvantages compared to larger competitors benefitting from economies of scale.
As you can see below, Nature's Sunshine‚Äôs sales grew at a weak 1.3% compounded annual growth rate over the last three years. This shows it failed to generate demand in any major way and is a rough starting point for our analysis.
This quarter, Nature's Sunshine reported modest year-on-year revenue growth of 3.1% but beat Wall Street‚Äôs estimates by 5.2%.
Looking ahead, sell-side analysts expect revenue to grow 1.9% over the next 12 months, similar to its three-year rate. This projection is underwhelming and shows the market believes its newer products will not lead to better top-line performance yet.
Cash Is King Although earnings are undoubtedly valuable for assessing company performance, we believe cash is king because you can‚Äôt use accounting profits to pay the bills.Nature's Sunshine has shown mediocre cash profitability over the last two years, giving the company limited opportunities to return capital to shareholders. Its free cash flow margin averaged 4%, subpar for a consumer staples business.
Taking a step back, we can see that Nature's Sunshine‚Äôs margin dropped by 2.4 percentage points during that time. If this trend continues, it could signal it‚Äôs becoming a more capital-intensive business.
Nature's Sunshine‚Äôs free cash flow clocked in at $7.88 million in Q3, equivalent to a 6.9% margin. The company‚Äôs cash profitability regressed as it was 2 percentage points lower than in the same quarter last year, but it‚Äôs still above its two-year average. We wouldn‚Äôt read too much into this quarter‚Äôs decline because investment needs can be seasonal, leading to short-term swings. Long-term trends trump temporary fluctuations.
Key Takeaways from Nature's Sunshine‚Äôs Q3 Results We were impressed by how significantly Nature's Sunshine blew past analysts‚Äô EPS expectations this quarter. We were also excited its EBITDA outperformed Wall Street‚Äôs estimates. On the other hand, its gross margin missed analysts‚Äô expectations. Zooming out, we think this was a good quarter with some key areas of upside. The stock traded up 1.9% to $14.06 immediately following the results.

author: NA
title: Italy bears severest weather on record in 2023: reports | The Star
text:
ROME, Dec. 28 (Xinhua) -- Italy has experienced a record-setting number of extreme weather events in 2023, a year that is set to be the warmest in more than 150 years, reports said on Thursday.
According to the climate observatory run by the environmental lobby group Legambiente, Italy reported 378 severe weather events in 2023, an increase of 22 percent compared to last year -- ranging from heatwaves to drought and from hailstorms to floods and extreme winds, which were directly responsible for at least 31 deaths.
On the other hand, the agriculture sector union Coldiretti said there were more than nine harsh weather events per day this year across Italy's boot-shaped peninsula.
In its report, Coldiretti estimated that extreme weather caused a record 6 billion euros (6.6 billion U.S. dollars) of damages to crops and agricultural infrastructure, leading to shortfalls in the country's production of olive oil, peaches, nectarines and wheat.
Legambiente said its calculations showed that the northern part of the country was hit the hardest, with 210 separate extreme weather events, followed by 98 in the central regions and 70 in the south which includes the island regions of Sicily and Sardinia.
Among the extreme weather events were floods, record high temperatures, rain-triggered landslides and hailstorms, it said.
Much of Europe suffered a long and dry summer and multiple severe weather events this year, but Italy is often hit harder due to its long coastline and exposure to the sea on two coasts. Meteorological data indicate that this year is set to be the warmest in more than 150 years of record-keeping in Italy.
Meanwhile, weather agencies predict the year will end with an unusually warm spell, with high daytime temperatures across much of the Italian peninsula, assuring that 2024 will start out on the warm side.

author: Diario de Pernambuco
title: Venda e consumo de bebidas alco√≥licas est√£o proibidos em eventos da Igreja, determina Arquidiocese de Olinda e Recife
text:
Religi√£o
Venda e consumo de bebidas alco√≥licas est√£o proibidos em eventos da Igreja, determina Arquidiocese de Olinda e Recife
Decreto foi publicado pelo arcebispo de Olinda e Recife, dom Paulo Jackson
Por:
Diario de PernambucoPublicado em: 21/02/2025 09:43 | Atualizado em: 21/02/2025 09:46
Dom Paulo Jackson assinou decreto (Foto: Arquivo) |
A Arquidiocese de Olinda e Recife proibiu a venda e do consumo de bebidas alco√≥licas em quermesses e outros eventos organizados e promovidos pelas igrejas, movimentos ou pastorais em seu territ√≥rio.
Essa determina√ß√£o est√° prevista em um decreto publicado na quinta (20), pelo arcebispo dom Paulo Jackson.
Essa decis√£o, segundo a arquidiocese, j√° havia sido tomada pelo arcebispo anterior, dom Fernando Saburido.
Apesar dessa determina√ß√£o, havia par√≥quias e grupos que desobedeciam √†s diretrizes arquidiocesanas e vendiam bebidas alco√≥licas em festas e eventos.
Veja o decreto
CONSIDERANDO o ensinamento da Igreja Cat√≥lica sobre a virtude da temperan√ßa que leva a evitar toda esp√©cie de excessos (cf. Catecismo da Igreja Cat√≥lica, n. 2290);
CONSIDERANDO o Documento CNBB
100, n. 286 (Par√≥quia,
Comunidade de comunidades), em que se indica: "Especialmente nas festas de padroeiros e outros eventos religiosos, a venda de bebidas alco√≥licas contrasta com os programas de defesa da vida e combate √† drogadi√ß√£o que a Igreja promove.
Uma das drogas mais amea√ßadoras da sociedade √© o
√°lcool. (...) E urgente a convers√£o das comunidades paroquiais para evitar o contratestemunho de promover o consumo de √°lcool em quermesses ou outras atividades recreativas da comunidade";
CONSIDERANDO a reflex√£o feita no dia 26 de outubro de 2024, por ocasi√£o da primeira sess√£o do nosso S√≠nodo Arquidiocesano, e no dia 11 de fevereiro de 2025, na reuni√£o do clero.
DETERMINAMOS, por este nosso decreto, que ficam proibidos a venda e o consumo de bebidas alco√≥licas nas quermesses e outros eventos organizados e promovidos pelas igrejas, movimentos, pastorais ou servi√ßos no territ√≥rio da Arquidiocese de Olinda e Recife.

author: Bruna Fantti
title: Pol√≠cia do RJ identifica envolvidos na morte de PM na Mar√© - 13/06/2024 - Cotidiano - Folha
text:
A Polcia Civil do Rio de Janeiro afirma que identificou dois suspeitos de participar da troca de tiros com agentes do Bope (Batalho de Operaes Policiais Especiais) durante operao na Mar, na zona norte, na tera (11), que resultou na morte do sargento Jorge Henrique Galdino Cruz, 32. Outro agente ferido a tiros segue internado.
Na ocasio, quatro suspeitos de ligao com o trfico tambm foram mortos. Outros 24 homens foram presos sob suspeita de ligao com o trfico, ainda segundo a polcia pelo menos oito so de outros estados.
Policiamento na Mar, zona norte do Rio, nesta quinta (13) - Leitor Os suspeitos agora procurados pela polcia foram identificados como Ronald de Souza Gomes, de apelido Titio do Adeus, e Luciano Cndido Crispim, conhecido como Pitbull. A Folha no conseguiu localizar a defesa dos suspeitos.
Segundo nota da Polcia Civil, "ambos so seguranas de duas das lideranas da faco criminosa que atua na localidade, Thiago da Silva Folly (vulgo TH) e Michel de Souza Malveira (vulgo Bill, Bfalo Bill ou Csar), respectivamente".
Ainda de acordo com a polcia, os agentes do Bope estavam em confronto com criminosos e teriam chegado aos lderes da quadrilha quando sofreram uma emboscada de um segundo grupo. "As investigaes continuam para identificar e responsabilizar todos os envolvidos no ataque e integrantes daquela organizao criminosa", diz a corporao.
Na tarde desta quinta (13), peritos da Polcia Civil estiveram na Mar para fazer percia no local onde houve a troca de tiros que acarretou na morte do sargento do Bope e foram recebidos a tiros, afirma a corporao. Ningum ficou ferido, e tambm no houve prises.
Por causa da percia, duas escolas estaduais da regio optaram por suspender as aulas.
Na tera, aps a troca de tiros, criminosos ordenaram o fechamento das linhas Vermelha e Amarela e da avenida Brasil, principais ligaes entre as zonas norte e oeste e a regio central. Segundo a PM, criminosos atearam fogo em um nibus na avenida Brasil, na altura da Fiocruz (Fundao Oswaldo Cruz).
A operao da tera foi deflagrada para prender suspeitos de roubos de veculos que estariam escondidos em favelas da Mar, como Vila dos Pinheiros, Vila do Joo, Timbau e Baixa do Sapateiro.

author: AOL Staff
title: Woman stole Walmart shoppers' horse and buggy while they were inside Michigan store
text: Woman stole Walmart shoppers' horse and buggy while they were inside Michigan store A woman stole a family's horse and Amish buggy while they were shopping inside a Michigan Walmart, police said. The family discovered the animal and buggy were missing after finishing their shopping at the Sturgis, Mich., store Saturday, according to a Sturgis Police Department release posted on Facebook. A truck driver who was parked at Walmart told police that a woman had stolen the buggy and gave officials a description of her. Police said they had contact with the woman earlier that day at the same Walmart location. Later that night, police said they found the stolen horse and buggy and made contact with the 31-year-old woman at a nearby motel where she was arrested without incident. She was booked at the St. Joseph County Jail on charges of larceny and larceny of livestock pending an arraignment, according to police. The horse was not harmed and the buggy was returned, police said. Sturgis is just over 50 miles northwest of South Bend, Ind.

author: Orlando Mastrillo
title: Maria Chiara Gadda: "L'agroalimentare soffre ancora la peste suina"
text:
Maria Chiara Gadda: ‚ÄúL‚Äôagroalimentare soffre ancora la peste suina‚Äù
La deputata di Fagnano Olona: "Spero che il ministro Lollobrigida si attivi, perch√© ad oggi non ci sono risposte. Il Made in Italy non si difende solo nei talk show, ma con misure concrete"
‚ÄúL‚Äôagroalimentare sta affrontando forti difficolt√† a causa della diffusione della Peste suina africana, che non tende ad arrestarsi. Servono risposte‚Äù. Lo ha detto la deputata Maria Chiara Gadda , vicepresidente dei deputati di Italia Viva, illustrando un ordine del giorno al decreto Milleproroghe. ‚ÄúQuesta situazione ha reso complesso per le aziende, ad esempio, del Distretto del Cibo dei Salumi DOP Piacentini, l‚Äôottenimento della documentazione richiesta per l‚Äôaccesso alle agevolazioni e ai finanziamenti previsti dai contratti. Il decreto milleproroghe poteva essere una opportunit√† per trovare una soluzione e per sbloccare risorse utili agli investimenti. Il parere contrario al mio ordine del giorno non √® una buona notizia per una filiera cos√¨ eccellente del nostro made in Italy. Spero che il ministro Lollobrigida si attivi, perch√© il comparto vive da mesi una condizione di incertezza e ad oggi non ci sono risposte. Il Made in Italy non si difende solo nei talk show, ma con misure concrete‚Äù, ha concluso Gadda.

author: WPTV - Staff
title: Wild crash: Driver arrested after fleeing traffic stop, slamming into truck
text: A construction crew narrowly escaped the path of a reckless driver, highlighting the tough balance law enforcement faces when deciding whether or not to pursue a fleeing suspect. Cody Nance, 33, of Arkansas was arrested this week in Martin County after deputies said he fled law enforcement at speeds exceeding 100 mph, later crashing near a nighttime construction crew. A video posted on the Martin County Sheriff's Office's Facebook page showed the dramatic end of the pursuit of the driver. "We had probably as horrific a car chase as you could have, the kind that keeps you up at night in fear that fleeing car would kill an innocent bystander," Martin County Sheriff William Snyder said. Chief Deputy John Budensiek said the incident started when a deputy tried to pull over Nance in the Jensen Beach area for a tag issue. Budensiek said Nance took off toward Port St. Lucie driving recklessly at more than 100 mph, leading the deputy on a brief chase, before the deputy was forced to stop pursuing to protect public safety. "Our deputy, because of our pursuit policy, was forced to terminate the ground pursuit," Budensiek said. Budensiek said the sheriff's office helicopter kept following Nance from the sky. Aerial video showed the car getting on the northbound lanes of Interstate 95 near Becker Road going the wrong way, narrowly missing another driver. The car then continued speeding back toward Martin County and headed directly toward the intersection of Martin Highway and Citrus Boulevard in Palm City, where CWR contracting crews were paving the road. "Our deputies had to reengage in order to stop the vehicle from careening into the construction crews," Budensiek said. Budensiek said deputies tried to intercept the car by putting up stop sticks to pop the car's tires before it reached the construction site. Trevor Pearson, a safety specialist with CWR Construction, said he received a call from a deputy warning him to clear out his crews. "We‚Äôre really thankful for the sheriff's department," Pearson said. Four minutes after Pearson said crews cleared out, aerial video showed Nance's car hit Stop Sticks, careen off the road and slam into a rented water truck. "Due to his excessive speed, Nance overcorrected when he hit the stingers and slammed into a water truck while construction workers watched from the side of the road," the sheriff's office said. Pearson said multiple workers could have been hit. "There were probably 10-12 guys working that got to go home that night," Pearson told WPTV reporter Kate Hussey. "Without their response, that might not have been the outcome?" Hussey asked. "That's very well possible," answered Pearson. Nance got out of the vehicle and was taken into custody by deputies. He was then taken to the hospital with injuries described as not life-threatening. The sheriff's office said he faces charges of fleeing and eluding, driving with a suspended license, petit theft, failure to register a motor vehicle, aggravated fleeing and eluding, and breaking and entering parole violation. None of the work crews or other drivers were injured during the incident. It's perhaps a happy ending to a chase at a time when high-speed police pursuits are a hot topic on the Treasure Coast. In the past year, three high-speed police responses led to the deaths of innocent bystanders. The most recent happened in Stuart last week when a fleeing suspect led a Stuart police officer on a pursuit on U.S. Highway 1. The suspect hit a MARTY Bus, which slammed into another car and killed an innocent driver. Police Chief Joseph Tuminelli told WPTV the officer, so far, appears to have been following protocol, but sat down with Hussey on Tuesday to talk about whether police pursuits are always necessary or appropriate. "This [latest incident] kind of highlights how, when we follow our pursuit policies, that doesn't mean these criminals are just shutting it down also," Budensiek said. "And had your deputies not re-engaged, this could have been a different scenario," Hussey said. "They're still running at 100 plus mph through our county, continuing to endanger our community," agreed Budensiek. Budensiek said it's a tough balance to strike, deciding whether or not to pursue a fleeing suspect. He said while police pursuits often end badly, and always have, with more growth on the Treasure Coast, comes more cars on the road and more opportunity for an innocent bystander to get caught in the crosshairs of a car chase. However, he said letting a fleeing suspect go often isn't the right option either. "Our No. 1 goal is public safety, however, that looks," Budensiek said. "We have seen that not pursuing suspects only creates more people running here in the county." "Is it safe to say you guys are looking at alternate methods of striking that balance, like your aviation unit?" Hussey asked. "We have to strike a balance. We can't just let these guys run from us all the time, but we're also going to be extremely thoughtful in how we catch them," Budensiek said. "We've had enough bad outcomes where we're constantly reminded that this could happen here in Martin County to one of our citizens, one of our family members." Budensiek said some of the alternatives the agency is looking at include pursuing with aviation units instead of with patrol cars. He also said using trucks to block the paths of fleeing vehicles is another alternative the agency is now utilizing. Tuminelli told Hussey on Tuesday his department is also looking at potentially utilizing Stop Sticks in the future. Scripps Only Content 2024

author: acarnes@elcierredigital.com (Andrea Carn√©s)
title: 'M√°s tormentas fuertes': Jorge Rey avisa de que la DANA 'no ha terminado'
text:
OCIO
'M√°s tormentas fuertes': Jorge Rey avisa de que la DANA 'no ha terminado'
La situaci√≥n de inestabilidad persiste en varias regiones, y las tormentas a√∫n no han terminado, seg√∫n las Caba√±uelas
La borrasca DANA contin√∫a su impacto en Espa√±a, y, como apunta Jorge Rey, el clima inestable seguir√° afectando a diversas zonas del pa√≠s en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. Pese a los esfuerzos de los servicios meteorol√≥gicos y de emergencia, en muchas √°reas se experimenta ya un fuerte desgaste:
"Desesperaci√≥n en Valencia, absoluto caos." Los efectos del fen√≥meno atmosf√©rico se han sentido especialmente en el Levante. Donde las fuertes lluvias han desbordado calles, saturado los sistemas de drenaje y generado situaciones de emergencia en ciudades y poblaciones peque√±as.
A lo largo de esta semana, las bajas presiones se mantendr√°n activas en todo el pa√≠s. Especialmente en las zonas de Valencia, Castell√≥n, Tarragona y otros puntos de la costa mediterr√°nea.
Esta DANA, bautizada como Orestes, "no ha terminado", afirma Jorge Rey. Traer√° consigo m√°s lluvias intensas y "tormentas fuertes", especialmente en las √°reas de Levante y Extremadura.
